title: Hanuman Chalisa
author: Tulsidas
introduction:
The Hanuman Chalisa is a Hindu devotional hymn addressed to Lord Hanuman, a devout follower of Lord Rama and a central character in the epic Ramayana. Composed in the Awadhi language by the 16th-century poet Tulsidas, it is one of the most widely recited Hindu texts, revered for its power to invoke courage, strength, and protection.

The word 'Chalisa' derives from 'Chalis,' meaning forty in Hindi, referring to the 40 main verses (Chaupais) that form the core of the prayer. The complete recitation is traditionally counted as 43 sections, including two preliminary couplets (Dohas) that set the stage, and one final couplet that concludes the invocation.

The text glorifies Hanuman's immense strength, wisdom, celibacy, and unwavering devotion to Lord Rama. Reciting the Chalisa is believed to ward off evil spirits and negativity, alleviate suffering, and grant the devotee the virtues of knowledge and fortitude, making it a powerful spiritual anchor for millions of devotees worldwide.

chapters.name: Hanuman Chalisa
chapters.summary: A 43-section devotional hymn composed by Tulsidas in praise of Lord Hanuman, comprising two introductory Dohas (verses 1-2), forty Chaupais (verses 3-42), and a concluding Doha (verse 43). This hymn is central to the worship of Hanuman and is recited to invoke his strength, wisdom, and protection.

verses.original:
श्रीगुरु चरन सरोज रज निज मनु मुकुरु सुधारि |
बरनउँ रघुबर बिमल जसु जो दायकु फल चारि ||
verses.transliteration:
śrīguru carana sarōja raja nija manu mukuru sudhāri
baraṇauṁ raghubara bimala jasu jō dāyaku phala cāri

translations.english: Cleansing the mirror of my mind with the dust from the lotus feet of the Divine Guru, I describe the pure glory of Raghubir (Lord Rama), which bestows the four fruits of life (Dharma, Artha, Kama, Moksha).

verses.original:
बुद्धिहीन तनु जानिके सुमिरौं पवनकुमार |
बल बुद्धि बिद्या देहु मोहिं हरहु कलेस बिकार ||
verses.transliteration:
buddhihīna tanu jānikē sumirauṁ pavana kumāra
bala buddhi vidyā dēhu mōhiṁ harahu kalēsa bikāra

translations.english: Knowing my body to be devoid of intelligence, I remember the Son of the Wind (Hanuman). Grant me strength, wisdom, and knowledge, and remove my afflictions and impurities.

verses.original:
जय हनुमान ज्ञान गुन सागर |
जय कपीस तिहुँ लोक उजागर ||
verses.transliteration:
jaya hanumāna jñāna guna sāgara
jaya kapīśa tihuṁ lōka ujāgara

translations.english:
Victory to Hanuman, the ocean of wisdom and virtue.
Victory to the Lord of the monkeys, who illuminates the three worlds.

verses.original:
राम दूत अतुलित बल धामा |
अंजनि पुत्र पवनसुत नामा ||
verses.transliteration:
rāma dūta atulita bala dhāmā
aṁjani putra pavanasuta nāmā

translations.english:
You are the messenger of Rama, possessing immeasurable strength.
You are known as the son of Anjana and the son of the Wind-god.

verses.original:
महाबीर बिक्रम बजरंगी |
कुमति निवार सुमति के संगी ||
verses.transliteration:
mahābīra bikrama bajaraṁgī
kumati nivāra sumati kē saṁgī

translations.english:
Great hero, powerful and valiant, with a body like a thunderbolt.
You are the dispeller of evil intellect and the companion of good sense.

verses.original:
कंचन बरन बिराज सुबेसा |
कानन कुंडल कुंचित केसा ||
verses.transliteration:
kaṁcana barana birāja subēsā
kānana kuṇḍala kuṁcita kēsā

translations.english:
You are radiant with a golden complexion and are adorned in fine clothes.
You wear ear-rings and have beautiful, curly hair.

verses.original:
हाथ बज्र औ ध्वजा बिराजै |
काँधे मूँज जनेऊ साजै ||
verses.transliteration:
hātha bajra au dhvajā birājai
kāṁdhē mūṁja janē’ū sājai

translations.english:
In your hands, a thunderbolt (gada) and a banner shine.
On your shoulder, the sacred thread (Janeu) made of Moonj grass is adorned.

verses.original:
शंकर सुवन केसरी नंदन |
तेज प्रताप महा जग बंदन ||
verses.transliteration:
śaṁkara suvana kēsari naṁdana
tēja pratāpa mahā jaga baṁdana

translations.english:
You are the embodiment of Lord Shiva and the son of Kesari.
Your valor and great glory are worshipped by the whole world.

verses.original:
विद्यावान गुनी अति चातुर |
राम काज करिबे को आतुर ||
verses.transliteration:
vidyāvāna gunī ati cātura
rāma kāja karibē kō ātura

translations.english:
You are learned, virtuous, and extremely clever.
You are always eager to perform the deeds of Lord Rama.

verses.original:
प्रभु चरित्र सुनिबे को रसिया |
राम लखन सीता मन बसिया ||
verses.transliteration:
prabhu caritra sunibē kō rasiyā
rāma lakhana sītā mana basiyā

translations.english:
You delight in hearing the accounts of the Lord (Rama).
Rama, Lakshmana, and Sita reside in your heart.

verses.original:
सूक्ष्म रूप धरि सियहिं दिखावा |
बिकट रूप धरि लंक जरावा ||
verses.transliteration:
sūkṣma rūpa dhari siyahiṁ dikhāvā
bikaṭa rūpa dhari laṁka jarāvā

translations.english:
You appeared before Sita in a tiny form.
Assuming a formidable form, you burnt the city of Lanka.

verses.original:
भीम रूप धरि असुर सँहारे |
रामचंद्र के काज सँवारे ||
verses.transliteration:
bhīma rūpa dhari asura saṁhārē
rāmacandra kē kāja saṁvārē

translations.english:
Taking a gigantic form, you destroyed the demons (Asuras).
Thus, you accomplished the tasks of Shri Rama.

verses.original:
लाय सजीवन लखन जियाए |
श्री रघुबीर हरषि उर लाए ||
verses.transliteration:
lāya sanjīvana lakhana jiyāē
śrī raghubīra haraṣi ura lāē

translations.english:
You brought the Sanjeevani herb and revived Lakshmana.
Shri Rama embraced you joyfully.

verses.original:
रघुपति कीन्ही बहुत बड़ाई |
तुम मम प्रिय भरतहि सम भाई ||
verses.transliteration:
raghupati kīnhī bahuta baṛā’ī
tuma mama priya baratahi sama bhā’ī

translations.english:
The Lord of Raghus (Rama) praised you greatly.
"You are dear to me, just like my brother Bharat," he said.

verses.original:
सहस बदन तुम्हरो जस गावैं |
अस कहि श्रीपति कंठ लगावैं ||
verses.transliteration:
sahasa badana tumharō jasa gāvaīṁ
asa kahi śrīpati kaṁṭha lagāvaīṁ

translations.english:
May the thousand-mouthed Shesha sing your glory.
Saying this, the Goddess of Fortune’s Lord (Rama) embraced you.

verses.original:
सनकादिक ब्रह्मादि मुनीसा |
नारद सारद सहित अहीसा ||
verses.transliteration:
sanakādika brahmādi munīsā
nārada sārada sahita ahīsā

translations.english:
The sages like Sanaka, the great ascetics like Brahma,
Narada, Goddess Saraswati, and the King of Serpents (Shesha)...

verses.original:
जम कुबेर दिगपाल जहाँ ते |
कबि कोबिद कहि सकैं कहाँ ते ||
verses.transliteration:
jama kubēra digapāla jahāṁ tē
kabi kōbida kahi sakaiṁ kahāṁ tē

translations.english:
Yama, Kubera, and the guardians of the directions,
Where are the poets and scholars who can describe your glory fully?

verses.original:
तुम उपकार सुग्रीवहिं कीन्हा |
राम मिलाय राज पद दीन्हा ||
verses.transliteration:
tuma upakāra sugrīvahiṁ kīnhā
rāma milāya rāja pada dīnhā

translations.english:
You did a great favor to Sugriva.
By uniting him with Rama, you helped him regain his kingdom.

verses.original:
तुम्हरो मंत्र बिभीषन माना |
लंकेस्वर भए सब जग जाना ||
verses.transliteration:
tumharō mantra bibhīṣana mānā
laṁkēśvara bha’ē saba jaga jānā

translations.english:
Vibhishana obeyed your counsel.
He became the Lord of Lanka, which the whole world knows.

verses.original:
जुग सहस्र जोजन पर भानु |
लील्यो ताहि मधुर फल जानु ||
verses.transliteration:
juga sahasra yōjana para bhānu
līlyō tāhi madhura phala jānu

translations.english:
The sun, located thousands of miles away,
You swallowed it, assuming it to be a sweet fruit.

verses.original:
प्रभु मुद्रिका मेलि मुख माहीं |
जलधि लाँघि गये अचरज नाहीं ||
verses.transliteration:
prabhu mudrikā mēli mukha māhīṁ
jaladhi lāṁghi gayē acarāja nāhīṁ

translations.english:
Placing the Lord's ring in your mouth,
You crossed the ocean; there is no wonder in that.

verses.original:
दुर्गम काज जगत के जेते |
सुगम अनुग्रह तुम्हरे तेते ||
verses.transliteration:
durgama kāja jagata kē jētē
sugama anugraha tumharē tētē

translations.english:
Whatever difficult tasks there are in the world,
They all become easy through your grace.

verses.original:
राम दुआरे तुम रखवारे |
होत न आज्ञा बिनु पैसारे ||
verses.transliteration:
rāma du’ārē tuma rakhavārē
hōta na ājñā binu paisārē

translations.english:
You are the gatekeeper at the door of Rama.
No one can enter without your permission.

verses.original:
सब सुख लहै तुम्हारी सरना |
तुम रक्षक काहू को डरना ||
verses.transliteration:
saba sukha lahai tumhārī saranā
tuma rakṣaka kāhū kō ḍaranā

translations.english:
All happiness is found in seeking refuge in you.
When you are the protector, what is there to fear?

verses.original:
आपन तेज सम्हारो आपै |
तीनों लोक हाँक तें काँपै ||
verses.transliteration:
āpana tēja samhārau āpai
tīnōṁ lōka hāṁka tēṁ kāṁpai

translations.english:
Only you can control the force of your own splendor.
All three worlds tremble at your roar.

verses.original:
भूत पिसाच निकट नहिं आवै |
महाबीर जब नाम सुनावै ||
verses.transliteration:
bhūta pisāca nikaṭa nahiṁ āvai
mahābīra jaba nāma sunāvai

translations.english:
Evil spirits and ghosts dare not come near,
When the name of Mahavir (Hanuman) is uttered.

verses.original:
नासै रोग हरै सब पीरा |
जपत निरंतर हनुमत बीरा ||
verses.transliteration:
nāsai rōga harai saba pīrā
japata niraṁtara hanumata bīrā

translations.english:
All diseases are destroyed and all pains cease,
By constantly repeating the name of the brave Hanuman.

verses.original:
संकट तें हनुमान छुड़ावै |
मन क्रम बचन ध्यान जो लावै ||
verses.transliteration:
saṁkaṭa tēṁ hanumāna chuṛāvai
mana krama bacana dhyāna jō lāvai

translations.english:
Hanuman releases one from all crises,
Who meditates upon him with mind, action, and speech.

verses.original:
सब पर राम तपस्वी राजा |
तिन के काज सकल तुम साजा ||
verses.transliteration:
saba para rāma tapasvī rājā
tina kē kāja sakala tuma sājā

translations.english:
Rama is the ascetic King over all.
You successfully executed all of His missions.

verses.original:
और मनोरथ जो कोई लावै |
सोइ अमित जीवन फल पावै ||
verses.transliteration:
aura manōratha jō kō’ī lāvai
sō’i amita jīvana phala pāvai

translations.english:
And whoever brings any desire to you,
They shall receive the boundless fruit of life.

verses.original:
चारों जुग परताप तुम्हारा |
है परसिद्ध जगत उजियारा ||
verses.transliteration:
cārōṁ juga paratāpa tumhārā
hai parasiddha jagata ujiyārā

translations.english:
Your glory is celebrated in all four ages (Yugas).
Your fame is well-known, illuminating the world.

verses.original:
साधु संत के तुम रखवारे |
असुर निकंदन राम दुलारे ||
verses.transliteration:
sādhu saṁta kē tuma rakhavārē
asura nikaṁdana rāma dulārē

translations.english:
You are the guardian of saints and holy men.
You are the destroyer of demons, the beloved of Rama.

verses.original:
अष्ट सिद्धि नौ निधि के दाता |
अस बर दीन जानकी माता ||
verses.transliteration:
aṣṭa siddhi nau nidhi kē dātā
asa bara dīna jānakī mātā

translations.english:
You are the bestower of the eight Siddhis (powers) and nine Nidhis (treasures).
Mother Janaki (Sita) granted you this boon.

verses.original:
राम रसायन तुम्हरे पासा |
सदा रहो रघुपति के दासा ||
verses.transliteration:
rāma rasāyana tumharē pāsā
sadā rahō raghupati kē dāsā

translations.english:
You hold the elixir of Rama’s name (the devotion to Rama).
May you always remain the servant of Raghupati (Rama).

verses.original:
तुम्हरे भजन राम को भावै |
जनम जनम के दुख बिसरावै ||
verses.transliteration:
tumharē bhajana rāma kō bhāvai
janama janama kē dukha bisarāvai

translations.english:
Your devotion is pleasing to Lord Rama.
It helps one forget the suffering of countless births.

verses.original:
अंत काल रघुबर पुर जाई |
जहाँ जन्म हरि भक्त कहाई ||
verses.transliteration:
aṁta kāla raghubara pura jā’ī
jahāṁ janma hari bhakta kahā’ī

translations.english:
At the time of death, one goes to the divine abode of Rama,
Where one is known as a devotee of Hari (God) in the next birth.

verses.original:
और देवता चित्त न धरई |
हनुमत सेइ सर्ब सुख करई ||
verses.transliteration:
aura dēvatā citta na dhara’ī
hanumata sēi sarba sukha kara’ī

translations.english:
By not considering any other deity in mind,
Serving Hanuman ensures all happiness.

verses.original:
संकट कटै मिटै सब पीरा |
जो सुमिरै हनुमत बलबीरा ||
verses.transliteration:
saṁkaṭa kaṭai miṭai saba pīrā
jō sumirai hanumata balabīrā

translations.english:
All troubles are cut away, and all pain is removed,
For those who remember the mighty and brave Hanuman.

verses.original:
जय जय जय हनुमान गोसाईं |
कृपा करहु गुरुदेव की नाईं ||
verses.transliteration:
jaya jaya jaya hanumāna gōsā’īṁ
kṛpā karahu gurudēva kī nā’īṁ

translations.english:
Victory, Victory, Victory to Lord Hanuman!
Bestow your mercy upon me, just like a great Guru.

verses.original:
जो सत बार पाठ कर कोई |
छूटहि बंदि महा सुख होई ||
verses.transliteration:
jō sata bāra pāṭha kara kō’ī
chūṭahi baṁdi mahā sukha hō’ī

translations.english:
Whoever recites this (Chalisa) one hundred times,
Is freed from bondage and attains great joy.

verses.original:
जो यह पढ़ै हनुमान चालीसा |
होय सिद्धि साखी गौरीसा ||
verses.transliteration:
jō yaha paṛhai hanumāna cālīsā
hōya siddhi sākhī gaurīsā

translations.english:
He who reads this Hanuman Chalisa,
Achieves success, with Lord Shiva (Gaurisa) as the witness.

verses.original:
तुलसीदास सदा हरि चेरा |
कीजै नाथ हृदय महँ डेरा ||
verses.transliteration:
tulasīdāsa sadā hari cērā
kījainātha hṛdaya mahaṁ ḍērā

translations.english:
Tulsidas is always the servant of the Lord (Hari).
O Lord, please reside forever in my heart.

verses.original:
पवन तनय संकट हरन मंगल मूरति रूप |
राम लखन सीता सहित हृदय बसहु सुर भूप ||
verses.transliteration:
pavana tanaya saṁkaṭa harana maṁgala mūrati rūpa
rāma lakhana sītā sahita hṛdaya basahu sura bhūpa

translations.english:
O Son of the Wind, remover of distress, the embodiment of good fortune,
Reside in my heart along with Rama, Lakshmana, and Sita, O King of Gods.
